item.title: How Analytics can help you to grow & retain your studio memberships post COVID-19
item.dc:creator: Studiosuccess
item.description:
Fitness businesses across the globe have felt the heat since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic. In US alone the industry has […]

The post How Analytics can help you to grow & retain your studio memberships post COVID-19 appeared first on StudioSuccess .
item.content:encoded:
Fitness businesses across the globe have felt the heat since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic. In US alone the industry has lost almost $13.9 billion. And that has trigerred many job loss and business shutsdowns.


As world is opening slowly and people are embracing the new normal owners need to take control of their bastion. And if you want to drive your fitness business forward, it’s time to embrace the change.

In a study of 2,000 fitness businesses in the UK, Australia, Hong Kong, Malaysia, and Ireland, researchers found that gym attendance bounced back 91% to pre-COVID levels.

In this article, we will talk about how fitness & wellness studios can use data to analyze their customers, improve their efficiency, and design a solid strategy to fight the financial impact of COVID-19.

Below are major KPIs fitness studios follow worldwide:

  • Average Revenue Per member
  • Customer Retention Rate
  • Average Daily Attendance
  • Average Profit Per Session
  • Revenue Per Sqft
  • Profit Margin
  • ROI for New Acquisitions
  • Average Loyalty Spending

These KPIs can be achieved by implementing complete analytics approach in a holistic way.

Expand Your Reach

As most fitness clubs are currently fighting for new members, the competition is fierce. But data can help you get ahead. By tracking your member retention rate, profit per session, and average daily attendance figures, you can identify trends in your member’s behavior.

 

Edge over competition

The fitness industry is more competitive than ever before. But by leveraging data, you can stand out. 

Start with a member feedback questionnaire about their satisfaction with the club. Then, choose 1 – 3 key selling points based on the most liked ones which your competition doesn’t have or lacking. This could be selling points like:

  • Opening hiurs
  • Cleanliness
  • equipment
  • Instructors
  • Atmosphere
  • Home Session

Once you’ve identified the key selling points, work them into your marketing campaigns and give yourself a competitive edge by making your identity your focus point.

Member Retention & Loyalty

If you pay attention to new eCommerce trends, you may have digital marketing experts discuss “personalization.” Personalization is the practice of adjusting service to the buyer’s tastes and preferences. And it’s vital in fitness, too.

By collecting data on your members, you can understand what they want from their membership. This will help you choose ways to personalize your studio and boost member satisfaction ultimately solving the largest  problem of revenue leakage.

Fix the Classic “Membership Churn” issue

Most fitness studios and gyms lose approximately 50 % of their new members in the six months after they sign up. Naturally, many clubs invest heavily in decreasing their churn rate.

research shows that 91% of customers are more likely to stay loyal to a business that provides a good customer experience.

And with data, you can make those investments with confidence – as you can predict when you will churn members. This will help you put data-based strategies into place to retain members, including improving your member experience.

In a study of 2,000 US gyms, researchers found that 18% of clubs closed permanently, 32% closed temporarily, and 50% are still open today. However, those gyms are still struggling – as they lost 20% of their members on average.

But if you’re in this sticky situation, data can help. By tracking fitness studio KPIs like your revenue per member, client retention rate, average daily attendance, profit per session, revenue per square foot, and profit margin, you can design a data-driven strategy to guide your Fitness Studio through COVID-19.

The post How Analytics can help you to grow & retain your studio memberships post COVID-19 appeared first on StudioSuccess .

item.title: 10 Professional Growth Marketing tools for Fitness Studios
item.dc:creator: Studiosuccess
item.description:
If you are a Fitness Studio Owner looking to boost your marketing strategies and ROI, you should know about certain tools that […]

The post 10 Professional Growth Marketing tools for Fitness Studios appeared first on StudioSuccess .
item.content:encoded:
If you are a Fitness Studio Owner looking to boost your marketing strategies and ROI, you should know about certain tools that can make life easier.

After facing the turbulent times in 2020, you have to focus on creating better and innovative strategies in 2022 to stay ahead in competition. Here are the
curated list of Top 10 tool that will help you to achieve your marketing goals.

Top 10 Digital Marketing tools for Yoga Studio, Gym, Pilates Studio Owners

  1. MailChimp
  2. Google Analytics
  3. Google Ads
  4. Canvas
  5. FB/Insta Ads
  6. Slack
  7. Yoast SEO
  8. Survey Anyplace
  9. Ahrefs
  10. SEMRUSH

 

1. MailChimp

MailChimp is an advanced email marketing tool designed to orchestrate and automate digital marketing campaigns.
It is one of the best digital marketing tools you can get to improve your campaigns and track the traffic generated.
On top of that MailChimp allows multiple integrations with different other tools. MailChimp is quite efficient for email campaigns,
using which you can engage with your audience.

 

2. Google Analytics

Google Analytics provides you with information about traffic on your website that is divided by devices, products, pages, and more, thus helps you to
take numerous decisions, be it advertisement or website modification. It helps you understand your target audience in a better way. You will get real-time
updates about your website visitors, even including the pages they are currently exploring. This can help you make your landing page more engaging by
providing the customers with a more intuitive experience.

 

3. Google Ads

Google Ads is a powerful tool that can take your business to new heights. While some marketers complaign about high pricing but it can be tackled if used /optimized properly.

( Get a Free session on Google Ads Optimization for Your Fitness Studio )

Its multiple targeting options allow you to target your customer base based on different factors like age, gender, location, profession, etc.
Google Ads with Google Analytics will certainly help you to retarget your past visitors through display advertising.

 

4. Canva

To market your studio through online or offline channel you need attractive and quality infographics that will create long standing impact in potential user’s mind.
Canva’s advanced yet simple tool allows you to design marketing colaterals without much of effort. Remember, visual content is backbone of your digital marketing campaign. You can create blog banners, infographics, flyers, posters, social media banners and even video posts.

 

5. Sotrender

Sotrender delivers the most pivotal, organic and paid social media metrics from Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and YouTube. The tool enables you to check for example: reach, engagement, users demography, comment sentiment, content overview and more. All data is presented on readable, easy-to-understand charts.
Sotrender makes it easy to track competitors’ social KPIs – both organic and paid. In Sotrender Ads, you are also able to gain insights into competitors’ monthly ad spend and campaign goals.

 

6. Hootsuite

If you are looking for a social media management solution, then Hootsuite is the perfect option. It allows you to store your content in a cloud system so that it can be accessed by the team members 24/7 for social media posting. Through this tool, you can schedule multiple posts at once along with developed tags and keywords.

Through this tool, you can even track the performance of your social media content. It can help you to calculate ROI, and conversions, about your brand.

 

7. Yoast SEO

Yoast SEO is one of the most widely used WordPress plugins that help digital marketers to optimize their websites to perform better in search results.

Allows you to write better content for your digital marketing campaigns. The plugin provides you access to the Yoast SEO meta box to add meta description and meta title for your content. Moreover, you don’t have to install a third-party plugin for XML sitemaps.

It helps with the details where WordPress cannot do much: for submitting sitemaps, managing keywords, creating content, and using webmaster tools, among other aspects.

 

8. Survey Anywhere

SurveyAnyplace is the best tool for marketing professionals to create fun and interactive quizzes, assessments, and surveys for their targeted customer base. It is a great digital marketing tool that will enable you to engage with your target audience and help build brand identity and personality.

If you are bored of traditional surveys to know the current demand for a product or business, you can use this tool to implement some quality surveys for your digital marketing campaigns that will help you in the long run.

 

9. Ahrefs

Ahrefs offer a suite of search engine optimization tools, making it easier for you to optimize your website based on your marketing requirements. It is primarily used for checking backlinks, and with its massive data index, the tool is definitely one of the most sought after digital marketing tools in the market.

10. SEMRUSH

SEMRUSH is an all-in-one marketing toolkit that helps grow the online visibility of the business with SEO, content marketing, market research, advertising, social media management and search engine reputation management.

 

With these tools, you will be able to better understand and manage your digital marketing campaigns. However, you need to know that while some of them offer a free trial, they are all paid. Still if you are stuck between your studio operation and marketing then ping us for a free consultation.

item.title: Top 9 Digital Marketing Strategies For Spas And Salons
item.dc:creator: Studiosuccess
item.description:
A well crafted digital marketing strategy can help spa & saloon  drive in more traffic. As a  owner, you would surely like […]

The post Top 9 Digital Marketing Strategies For Spas And Salons appeared first on StudioSuccess .
item.content:encoded:
A well crafted digital marketing strategy can help spa & saloon  drive in more traffic. As a  owner, you would surely like to have more clients and stand out from the rest. Initially, you may notice a lot of customers pouring in but you need to know the right tactics to keep up with that flow. It may seem to be a difficult task since you have a sea of competitors.

However, it is possible to do so if you have the right salon marketing strategies.

Create a dedicated website

These days having an online presence for businesses is a must due to the increasing number of internet users. Your salon website will create the first impression on your new clients and it will allow you to remain open 24*7.

Your clients come to know about the services that are offered along with the price, the offers, and the discount coupons. It will encourage clients to pre-book an appointment.

List in local online directories

Creating your salon website will not suffice and getting your salon listed in online directories is crucial. As per findings, 70% of the potential customers check for a product or service in search engines before actually availing it. 

Since Google is the most commonly used search engine, listing your salon with Google My Business, Yelp is a proven marketing strategy. Besides, people also refer to Yelp and Facebook before stepping into your salon.

Review matters

As per findings, about 92% of the customers rely on online reviews before making the final decision. A business without reviews creates a negative impression on customers even if it offers quality services.

So request your clients to write reviews about your salon services and the use of salon review software is also recommended. The reviews must show up on your digital salon app or the salon website.

Offer Referral Discount

You can offer your clients a small referral discount when they refer their friends to your salon and your services get advertised for free. Offering referral discounts would encourage your existing clients to bring new people to your salon enabling you to get new clients.

Local Partnerships

In order to attract new clients, you can collaborate with local businesses that have the same line of business such as restaurants, bars, health clubs, fashion retailers, etc. Partnering with local businesses and making a combination offer will help you to get some good quality clients.

Loyalty Program

You will surely have some clients who are happy and satisfied with your salon services and they keep coming back to you. As a mark of good gesture, you can offer those loyal customers a free service, free product samples, or a gift card.

For example, as a part of a Loyalty Program, you can give customers a stamp for the first three services and offer the fourth one without having to pay anything.

Promote on social media

When your salon has something special to offer, make sure that it appears on all your social media accounts that you have. Social media platforms like Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram will enable you to spread the word that there is something worth trying out at your salon.

Advertise through FB, Insta, Google Ads

About 20% of the total Facebook users have purchased something when they saw the advertisements while going through their Facebook News Feed. It is the same for Google Ads too. These advertisements target local people with specific interests and it is easy to attract them with this kind of marketing strategy.

Online Appointment booking facility

An online appointment booking system will surely bring more clients because your client hardly has time to call for an appointment. They can book an appointment through your website or mobile app even when they are on the go. You can also provide your email address for correspondence.

Hopefully, these spa & salon digital marketing strategies would improve your client base and grow your salon business.

item.title: Top 5 Growth Marketing Strategies for Yoga & Pilates Studio
item.dc:creator: Studiosuccess
item.description:
2020 was the year that has transformed the global fitness industry as a whole. In this testing time, many yoga studios are […]

The post Top 5 Growth Marketing Strategies for Yoga & Pilates Studio appeared first on StudioSuccess .
item.content:encoded:
2020 was the year that has transformed the global fitness industry as a whole. In this testing time, many yoga studios are forced to close, some have moved their services online in order to survive.

But overall, Yoga practice has proven to be a powerful tool for many dealing with the uncertainty and isolation due to lock-down across the globe.

As the globe is opening up slowly, many yogis are struggling in marketing space which in turn shrinking their class size.

 

Whether you are opening a new yoga studio, or an existing yoga studio owner, marketing strategy is very crucial to grow your post-pandemic business.

Take a look at our comprehensive checklist:

Very First thing : A Stunning Website

In this digital era if you are opening up a Yoga Studio, or already owns one then its very important to get a website built for your business which reflect your brand and theme. There are many free tools available, else you can depend on website designer who can built you a stunning website. Make sure the website has following features :

  • Responsiveness (Mobile, Tab responsive)

  • Social Media Integrated

  • Sign Up form for Email marketing

  • Schedule Booking System

  • AMP Optimized

  • Lead Funnel Optimized

 

Content is King & will make you King

Your content is key element of your website’s worthiness according to all the search engines. Also it plays an important role to boost your social media engagements.

As a business owner you have to devise a clear content strategy to achieve the desired outcome. Your website should consist of Blog Post, Video, Email Newsletters, Podcasts.

Social Media : The Infinite Customer Pool

Your social media pages are the real pool of customers where you will meet your potential students. Thus creation of an authentic and natural relationship off the mat also very important.

Also, the contents pushed in the website would also be distributed regularly through social channels to increase visibility and trustworthiness of your brand.

Google My Business : The Goldmine

Google handles over 90% of the searches across the globe, so its important register and maintain your business profile in GMB. Please make sure that your profile is “Complete”.

Also to remember that your GMB profile would become primary source of “reviews” shared by customers in near future.

In-case of Negative Reviews, please make sure you reply in a timely manner and with compassion.

Online Event Hosting : Freebies

Hosting a Open Entry Online Event with proper planning and advertisement would certainly increase your brand’s reach in your studio serviceable area.

This will eventually increase queries & rate of conversion would surely peak a new high.

 

If you are trying to find balance between your Practice Schedule & Yoga Studio Marketing, get in touch today for “A Free Consultation”.
